intro: Phyteuma pseudorbiculare, commonly known as the narrow-leaf phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to central and southern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are upright and branched. Phyteuma pseudorbiculare is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
